documents.title: Discussion on additional study of AI/ML for CSI compression
documents.summary: This document discusses the ongoing study of AI/ML for CSI compression, building on previous agreements made in earlier RAN meetings. It outlines the objectives for enhancing CSI feedback, including improving the trade-off between performance and complexity, and addressing inter-vendor training collaboration issues. The document presents detailed evaluations of temporal-spatial-frequency domain compression, agreements on evaluation assumptions, and the generation of datasets for the UMa scenario. It also discusses the use of Transformer architecture for compressing SVD-based precoder inputs and presents results comparing LSTM and MHA architectures. The document concludes with observations on inter-vendor collaboration, emphasizing the need for standardized signaling and the potential impacts of various options on performance and complexity. Overall, it serves as a comprehensive overview of the current state and future directions for AI/ML applications in CSI compression.

working_groups.name: Radio Access Network Working Group 1
working_groups.description: Focuses on the development and standardization of radio access technologies.

references.details: Revised WID on Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) for NR Air Interface, Qualcomm, RAN#105, Melbourne, Australia, September 9-12, 2024.
Study on Artificial Intelligence (AI)/Machine Learning (ML) for NR air interface (Release 18), V2.0.0 (2023-12).
Final summary of Additional study on AI/ML for NR air interface: CSI compression, Moderator (Qualcomm), 3GPP TSG RAN WG1 #116-bis, Changsha, China, April 15th – April 19th, 2024.
Chair's Notes RAN1#118, Maastricht, NL, August 19th – 23th, 2024.
Chairman's Notes RAN1#117, Fukuoka City, Fukuoka, Japan, May 20th – 24th, 2024.
